content:
The next morning dry gel for about lhr. When
completely dry, place gel over X-RAY film, and under
film place a Cronex intensifying screen. Wrap
together preferrably between stiff plates
of some kind, wrap in aluminum foil, and place in
-70 to expose film (note: intensifying screens do
not work much above -70, if they are not used the
film can be exposed at room temperature.
Intensifying screens speed exposure by about 3 fold)
SDS PAGE Pellet protein precipitate from previous day. Discard
the radioactive and dry the pellet under
vacuum
Set up vertical gel form, making sandwich by using
spacers to separate two glass plates. Determine the
internal volume off the sandwich. From stock
solutions (which will have been pre-made) prepare a
suuficiently large gel of: 25 mM Tris pH 6.8, 0.1%
SDS, and 15% Acrylamide/Bisacrylamide (take up
remaining volume with H20). Add a pinch of solid
Amonium persulfate, and mix:(note: be very careful
handling acrylamide as it is a known neurotoxin
until it has polymerized). Place flask under vacuum
for about 2 min (acrylamide will not polymerize in
air). Add about 50 ul of TEMED (this is the catalyst
that will drive polymerization; the speed of
polymerization can be controlled by varying the
amounts of TEMED and Ammonium Persulfate). Pour gel
into gel form leaving about l-2 cm form the bottom
of where wells will reach (measure this ahead of
time and mark with a pen). When gel is poured top
it off with a thin layer of butanol. Pour remaining
acrylamide solution into disposable glass tubes and
top these off with butanol (this will allow you to
monitor when the gel has hardened).
Prepare stacking gel of about 10 ml that is 3%
acrylamide, 25mM Tris pH 8.8, 0.1% SDS. Add
ammonium persulfate, mix and put under vacuum. When
the other gel has hardened, add 20 ul TEMED, mix,
and fill the remainig volume of the gel form with
stacking gel (remember to first pour off butanol).
Add comb and treat remaining acrylamide as before.
Allow gel to harden.
When stacking gel has polymerized, remove comb, and
add the gel form to vertical gel tank. Fill upper
and lower buffer chambers with running buffer.
Add 100 ul of SDS-Sample buffer, and boil for 2 min.
Remove 10 ul and count in ACS on scintillation
counter. Transfer smple to microcentrifuge tube.
Add 10 ul bromophenol blue. Add samples to wells.
Run gel at 30 mAmps until bromophenol blue has run
